summary: Prabhat Chhirolya Creative OS is a dark-themed, highly animated React + Tailwind single-page portfolio. It presents an immersive landing screen with an interactive cursor/touch-responsive background and a two-mode selector (Personal Journey / Professional Work). Each mode renders a long-form, internally scrollable narrative with scroll-triggered section reveals, horizontally scrollable project carousels, and reusable ProjectCard tiles that open modal overlays with rich details (text, optional image carousel, YouTube embeds, and external links). The repo also includes Internet Computer (ICP) scaffolding: Internet Identity authentication context, React Query–based backend actor creation/caching, and a Motoko blob-storage maintenance/admin mixin. SEO/social sharing is handled via canonical + Open Graph/Twitter meta tags in server-served index.html and a deployable ogcard.jpg asset with verification documentation.

existing_features.title: Three-mode portfolio UX (initial / personal / professional) with coordinated transitions
existing_features.description: Implements a landing state plus two narrative modes. Mode changes coordinate fade-out/fade-in timing, delayed content mounting, and a return-to-landing flow by clicking the name.

existing_features.title: Forced dark theme via document root class
existing_features.description: On app mount, adds the dark class to document.documentElement to enforce dark theme tokens regardless of system preference.

existing_features.title: Application-wide error boundary with fallback UI
existing_features.description: Catches render/runtime errors, logs them, and shows a full-screen fallback with a reload button to avoid white-screen failures.

existing_features.title: Landing cover background preload and fade-in
existing_features.description: Preloads the landing background image and fades it in once loaded; includes a gradient overlay to maintain text contrast.

existing_features.title: Interactive landing background (canvas point mesh + cursor-positioned radial overlay)
existing_features.description: Draws a dense point mesh on a canvas that brightens/grows/moves near pointer/touch position, plus a CSS radial overlay controlled via CSS variables. Only shown on the landing page.

existing_features.title: Mode selector UI with underline animation, hover parallax shift, and tap micro-motion
existing_features.description: Top navigation provides PERSONAL/PROFESSIONAL buttons with animated underline and active styling; background shifts subtly on hover; click triggers a short tap animation.

existing_features.title: Audio and haptic feedback on mode selection
existing_features.description: Mode selection attempts to play a tap sound and triggers device vibration on supported devices, with graceful handling if blocked/unsupported.

existing_features.title: Footer with mode-specific social links
existing_features.description: Shows a persistent footer with location text and a set of social/contact icons that changes depending on selected mode (personal vs professional).

existing_features.title: Unified identity block with return-to-landing interaction
existing_features.description: Displays greeting/name/tagline as a unified animated group; clicking the name while in a mode transitions back to the initial landing state.

existing_features.title: Morphing profile picture transitions with resize-driven re-measurement
existing_features.description: A single profile image element morphs between centered landing placement and mode selector geometry; resize/ResizeObserver triggers force re-measurement so morph alignment stays correct across responsive changes.

existing_features.title: ProjectCard tiles with modal project detail overlays

architectural_notes: Frontend is a React SPA (Vite-style entry) mounted in frontend/src/main.tsx and wrapped with React Query (QueryClientProvider) plus an InternetIdentityProvider context.
Core UX is a small mode state machine (initial/personal/professional) in LandingPage/App using timed fade choreography and delayed content mounting for smooth transitions.
Styling is Tailwind CSS extended with OKLCH design tokens and extensive bespoke CSS animations (section reveals, timeline vector motion, hover glows, morph transitions).
Landing visuals combine a preloaded cover background, a CSS overlay, and a canvas-based interactive mesh background driven by pointer/touch position.
Personal/Professional pages use internal scroll containers; scroll listeners add CSS classes to trigger staged entrance animations.
Projects are encapsulated in a reusable ProjectCard component that opens a modal overlay with optional YouTube embed, image carousel, and external CTAs.
Authentication scaffolding uses Dfinity AuthClient (Internet Identity) with persisted identity restoration; backend access is via an actor cached per principal and recreated on identity changes.
Backend is a minimal Motoko canister composed via a mixin that exposes blob-storage maintenance/admin endpoints (authorization refresh, dead-blob discovery/pruning, cycles top-up).
Production/static hosting on ICP is supported via .well-known assets and explicit asset inclusion rules in frontend/public/.ic-assets.json5.
SEO/social preview metadata is authored directly in frontend/index.html (canonical, Open Graph, Twitter) and validated via OG_PREVIEW_VERIFICATION.md.
known_issues: InteractiveBackground.tsx re-initializes the mesh animation effect whenever mousePos changes (effect depends on mousePos), causing unnecessary teardown/recreate work on every pointer move; mousePos should be stored in a ref or excluded from effect deps.
InteractiveBackground.tsx can divide by zero when distance === 0 (dx/distance, dy/distance), producing Infinity/NaN and possible rendering artifacts.

ProfessionalModeContent.tsx queues many setTimeout calls from inside the scroll handler for staggered reveals without cancellation/deduping; fast scrolling can schedule redundant timers and waste work.
ProfessionalModeContent.tsx defines carouselRefs but does not use them (unused refs / dead code).
ProfessionalModeContent.tsx uses the same toggle handler on onMouseEnter and onMouseLeave for ecosystem cards, which can cause expand/collapse flicker and conflicts with click toggling.
useModeSelectorRemeasure.ts depends on the identity of the elementRefs array; if callers pass a new inline array each render, observers can be re-registered unnecessarily.
backend/blob-storage/Storage.mo uses Nat.sub(currentBalance, reservedCycles) which can trap if currentBalance < reservedCycles.
backend/blob-storage/Storage.mo traps if env var CAFFFEINE_STORAGE_CASHIER_PRINCIPAL is missing, making deployment/config brittle.

backend/blob-storage/Mixin.mo stores authorization state in a transient variable (resets on upgrade) and _caffeineStorageUpdateGatewayPrincipals is callable without access control (any caller can trigger refresh).
backend/blob-storage/Mixin.mo _caffeineStorageCreateCertificate is a placeholder and does not implement real certificate creation/verification.
